title: How to Remove Adhesive From Concrete

steps.title: Decide on an adhesive remover to use.
steps.content: Decide on an adhesive remover to use. There are many types of removers that you can choose. You can find user-friendly and safe types of adhesive removers made with citric acid or soy bases. However, for adhesives that are difficult to remove, you will need to use a solvent-based adhesive.

steps.title: Apply the adhesive remover to the adhesive with a brush or trowel.
steps.content: Apply the adhesive remover to the adhesive with a brush or trowel. Allow the adhesive remover to sit for as long as the package directions recommend.

steps.title: Test the surface by scraping a small area to see if it is ready.
steps.content: Test the surface by scraping a small area to see if it is ready. If the adhesive does not come up easily, allow the remover to sit a little longer.

steps.title: Scrape the entire surface with a scraper, putty knife or a trowel with a flat edge and remove as much of the adhesive as possible.
steps.content: Scrape the entire surface with a scraper, putty knife or a trowel with a flat edge and remove as much of the adhesive as possible.

steps.title: Apply another coat of remover if needed.
steps.content: Apply another coat of remover if needed. Repeat until you have removed all the adhesive.

steps.title: Wipe up all the excess adhesive and rinse the area thoroughly with water.
steps.content: Wipe up all the excess adhesive and rinse the area thoroughly with water. Wipe it clean with rags.

steps.title: Allow the surface to dry thoroughly before painting, staining or applying new carpet, wood flooring or tile to the concrete.
steps.content: Allow the surface to dry thoroughly before painting, staining or applying new carpet, wood flooring or tile to the concrete.
